intro.text: 在本节课中,你将会学习如何向他人介绍你的国籍。
intro.nativeText: In this lesson, you are going to learn how to introduce your nationality to other people.

summary.text: 本节课中,我们学习了一些国家的名称,比如“美国”,“加拿大”,“法国”等。我们还学习了如何用“我是美国人”的陈述句型向他人介绍自己的国籍,以及用“你是哪国人？”的疑问句型询问他人的国籍。这就是今天的内容,你都掌握了吗？
summary.nativeText: In this lesson, we have learned the name of some countries, such as "America," "Canada," "France,"and so on. We have also learned how to use the declarative sentence "I am American" to introduce our nationality to others, and use the interrogative sentence "Where are you from?" to ask other people's nationalities. That's all for today. Have you got them all?

intro.text: 在本节课中,你将会学习一些关于交通工具的表达。

chatTurn.question: 客厅里有几张桌子？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: How many tables are there in the living room?

answers.text: 客厅里有两张桌子和六把椅子。
answers.nativeText: There are two tables and six chairs in the living room.
answers.keywords: 客厅,两张,桌子,和,六把,椅子

chatTurn.question: 你今天吃早饭了吗？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Did you have breakfast today?

answers.text: 我吃了，今天早上我妈妈把牛奶和面包放在厨房的桌子上了。
answers.nativeText: Yes, I did. My mother put milk and bread on the table in the kitchen this morning.
answers.keywords: 吃,今天,早上,妈妈,牛奶,面包,厨房,桌子
answers.help: “主语+把+物品1+动词+物品2”的句型可以用来来描述人的动作。
answers.nativeHelp: The sentence pattern “subject+把(bǎ)+object1+verb+object2” can used to describe one’s action.

chatTurn.question: 卫生间是被谁打扫的？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Who cleaned the washroom?

answers.nativeText: The washroom was cleaned by my brother yesterday's evening.
answers.keywords: 卫生间,昨天,晚上,哥哥,打扫干净
answers.help: 主语+被+动词
answers.nativeHelp: subject+被(bèi)+verb

answers.nativeText: No. The supermarket is very close to my house.

chatTurn.question: 你明天上午要去哪里？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Where are you going tomorrow morning?

answers.nativeText: I am going to the cinema with my elder sister tomorrow morning. It is on the east of the shopping mall.

intro.text: 在本节课中,你将会学习一些关于基础设施的表达。
intro.nativeText: In this lesson, you are going to learn some expressions of infrastructure.

summary.text: 本节课中,我们学习了一些关于基础设施的表达，比如“餐厅” ”电影院” “商场”和“超市”。我们还学习了如何用“我昨天晚上去了超市”的句型来描述过去发生的事情。这就是今天的全部内容。你都掌握了吗？
summary.nativeText: In this lesson, we have learned some expressions of infrastructure, such as “restaurant”, “cinema”, “shopping mall”, and “supermarket”.  We have also learned how to use the sentence pattern “I went to the supermarket yesterday evening” to describe things happened in the past. That's all for today. Have you got them all?

We have also learned how to use the interrogative sentence pattern “Excuse me, could you tell me how can I get to the cinema” to ask for directions. That's all for today. Have you got them all?

chatTurn.question: 请问电影院离这里远吗？

answers.text: 电影院离这里很近。它在商场的北边。

chatTurn.question: 请问从这里怎么去电影院？

answers.text: 沿着这条路向前走到尽头向左拐就是一个超市。
answers.nativeText: Go along this street and walk straight ahead to the end, and then turn left. You will find a supermarket.
answers.keywords: 沿着…路走到尽头，向前走，向左拐，超市
answers.help: 这里你可以说“沿着这条路向前走到尽头向左拐就是一个超市。”
answers.nativeHelp: Here you can say“沿着这条路向前走到尽头向左拐就是一个超市。”

chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Where should I go after seeing the supermarket?

answers.text: 电影院就在超市的对面。
answers.nativeText: The cinema is on the opposite of the supermarket.
answers.help: 这里你可以说“电影院就在超市的对面。”
answers.nativeHelp: Here you can say“电影院就在超市的对面。”

intro.text: 在本节课中,你将会学习一些关于基础设施的表达。
intro.nativeText: In this lesson, you are going to learn some expressions of infrastructure.

summary.text: 本节课中,我们学习了一些关于基础设施的表达，比如“医院” ”邮局” “银行”和“学校”。我们还学习了如何用“我今天下午要去医院”的句型来描述将来要发生的事。这就是今天的全部内容。你都掌握了吗？
summary.nativeText: In this lesson, we have learned some expressions of infrastructure, such as “hospital”, “post office”, “bank”, and “school”.  We have also learned how to use the sentence pattern “I am going to the hospital this afternoon” to describe things that will happen in the future. That's all for today. Have you got them all?

intro.text: 假设你刚来北京，要认识一位新朋友，她叫李微。这是你们第一次见面。
intro.nativeText: Assume that you just arrived in Beijing and are here to meet a new friend, Wei Li. This is your first time meeting.

summary.text: 在这一课你学会了怎么用中文介绍自己的名字、国籍和老家，学会了怎么向他人说明自己来中国的原因和打算。还学会了怎么得体地回应他人的称赞。
summary.nativeText: Congratulations! In this lecture, you have learned how to say your name, nationality, and hometown in Chinese. Apart from that, you can now clearly explain to other people why you want to come to China and what you plan to do here. On top of that, now you know how to properly respond to others’ compliments.

learningItem.nativeText: how long has it been since...?
In this pattern, the adjective describes how the verb is performed.

chatTurn.question: 你好！我叫李微，很高兴认识 你。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Hello, I’m Wei Li. It’s really nice to meet you.

answers.text: 你好，我叫王大卫，叫我大卫就行。
answers.nativeText: Hi, I’m David Wang, you can call me David.
answers.help: Here you can say 你好，我 叫 王大卫，叫 我 大卫 就 行。

chatTurn.question: 大卫，你是哪里人？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Where are you from, David?

answers.text: 我是美国人，老家是旧金山。
answers.nativeText: I’m an American, my hometown is San Francisco.
answers.help: Here you can say 我 是 美国人，老家 是 旧金山。

chatTurn.question: 我也一直想去美国看看。你来中国多久了？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: I have always wanted to visit the U.S. How long have you been in China?

answers.nativeText: I just arrived here in June.
answers.help: Here you can say 我 六月 刚 到 这里。

chatTurn.question: 你来中国旅行还是工作？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Did you come to China for business or pleasure?

answers.nativeText: I want to learn some Chinese first.
answers.help: Here you can say 我 想 先 学 中文。

chatTurn.question: 你在上课吗？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Are you taking any courses here?

answers.nativeText: Yes, I am now studying at Peking University.
answers.help: Here you can say 对，我 现在 在 北大 上课。

chatTurn.question: 难怪你的中文说得这么好！
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: It’s no wonder you speak Chinese so well!

answers.text: 谢谢！马马虎虎，还要努力。
answers.nativeText: Thanks. My Chinese is just so-so. There is still a lot to be desired.
answers.help: Here you can say 谢谢！马马虎虎，还 要 努力。

intro.text: 假设你家附近有个不错的水果店，今天你想去买点水果。
intro.nativeText: Suppose you live near a nice fruit stand. Today you want to buy some fruit.

summary.nativeText: Congratulations! In this lesson, you have learned how to ask if a store has an item, and if so, what its price is. Why not visit a fruit stand later today and practice everything that you have learned!

learningItem.desc: If it comes after a verb, the ‘一 yī’ can be dropped.
If you are not sure how the product is sold, for example, individually, by kilogram or by dozens, you can ask “怎么卖？zěnme mài? How is it sold?” Instead of “多少钱？ Duōshǎo qián? How much?”
An adjective followed by “的 de” becomes a noun, for example “大的 dàde” means big one.
For example, 有人吗？ yǒu rén ma? Is anyone there?
In Chinese 都dōu serves as an adverb. Thus, we never use 都 dōu with a noun.
In restaurant or coffee shop when you ask for something you can say “来 lái + noun”, for example “来一杯咖啡 lái yībēi kāfēi Bring me a cup of coffee.”

chatTurn.question: 你好，要买点儿什么？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Hello, may I help you?

answers.nativeText: Hello, how much are the apples?
answers.help: Here you can say 你好，这个苹果怎么卖？

chatTurn.question: 大的10块一斤，小的8块。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: For 500 grams: the bigger ones are 10 yuan, and the smaller ones are 8 yuan.

answers.nativeText: Are there any grapes?
answers.help: Here you can say 有葡萄吗？

chatTurn.question: 有啊，今天刚到的，很新鲜。也是8块。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Of course, they were just delivered today.  They are very fresh and are also 8 yuan per 500 grams.

answers.text: 好的，苹果和葡萄都来一点儿。
answers.nativeText: Okay, I want both some apples and grapes.
answers.help: Here you can say 好的，苹果和葡萄都来一点儿。

chatTurn.question: 好，我帮你拿。苹果要哪种？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Alright, I’ll get them for you. What kind of apple would you like?

answers.nativeText: I want the big ones.
answers.help: Here you can say 要大的。

chatTurn.question: 葡萄这么多，够吗？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Are these enough grapes?

answers.nativeText: That’s enough, thank you. How much are they?
answers.help: Here you can say 够了，谢谢。多少钱？

chatTurn.question: 一共36块4，给36吧。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: 36.4 yuan altogether, just give me 36.

answers.nativeText: OK. Here you are.
answers.help: Here you can say 好，给你。

intro.text: 你的语伴小微告诉你她下周要去香港，你想问她一些关于这次旅行的事情。
intro.nativeText: Your language partner, Xiao Wei, tells you that she is going to Hong Kong next week. You want to ask her about her trip.

summary.nativeText: Great job! Now you have learned phrases to express time, such as ‘when’ and ‘how long would it take’. Apart from that, you have also learned how to wish your friends a good trip. Try using them next time, and your friends would definitely be impressed.

learningItem.desc: In Chinese, we always put the time duration after the verb.
In this pattern, the adjective describes how the verb is performed.

chatTurn.question: 大卫，我下周要去香港，不能一起学习了。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: David, I'm going to Hong Kong next week. Sorry we can't study together.

answers.text: 没关系。你去出差还是去玩？
answers.nativeText: It’s OK. Are you going for business or pleasure?
answers.help: Here you can say 没关系。你去出差还是去玩？

chatTurn.question: 我去开会，然后会玩儿两天。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: I have a meeting there, and afterwards I will relax for two days.

answers.nativeText: That’s good. When are you leaving?
answers.help: Here you can say 那不错，你什么时候去？

chatTurn.question: 下周四的飞机。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: My flight is next Thursday.

answers.nativeText: How long are you staying?
answers.help: Here you can say 会呆多久呢？

chatTurn.question: 差不多四天，周日晚上回。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Almost four days. I come back on Sunday night.

answers.nativeText: Hopefully everything goes smoothly for you.
answers.help: Here you can say 那祝你一切顺利！

chatTurn.question: 谢谢。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Thank you.

answers.nativeText: Have a good time as well.
answers.help: Here you can say 还有玩得开心。

chatTurn.question: 哈哈，你的中文越来越好了。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Haha, your Chinese is getting better and better.

answers.nativeText: All thanks to your help.
answers.help: Here you can say 多亏了你的帮助。

intro.text: 常有中国朋友告诉你，火锅很好吃。今天你决定去尝尝。现在是中午12点，你和三位中文课的同学，来到了一家很有名的火锅连锁店。
intro.nativeText: Your Chinese friends often tell you that hot pot is delicious. Today you decide to try it at 12 noon. You and three Chinese classmates come to a famous hot pot chain.

summary.nativeText: Fantastic! Now you know how to make reservations in a restaurant, and how to wait for a table when they can’t take you immediately. Don’t forget to try hot pot when you come to China.

learningItem.desc: In Chinese, we always put the time duration after the verb.

chatTurn.question: 欢迎光临，请问几位？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Welcome, how many people?

answers.nativeText: We have four people.
answers.help: Here you can say 我们四位。

chatTurn.question: 不好意思，现在人比较多，还需要等位。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Sorry, we are very busy now. I’m afraid that you may need to wait for a table.

answers.nativeText: How long will it take?
answers.help: Here you can say 大概要等多久呢？

chatTurn.question: 前面还有4桌，要30分钟左右。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: There are four tables ahead of you, it will take about 30 minutes.

answers.nativeText: No problem. Let’s wait.
answers.help: Here you can say 没问题，我们等吧。

hintDetail.nativeText: a particle used at the end of sentence to indicate a suggestion

chatTurn.question: 这是你们的号，一会儿叫你们。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: This is your number. I will call you later.

answers.nativeText: Alright, we are No. 56.
answers.help: Here you can say 好的，我们是56号。

chatTurn.question: 56号四位，到你们了。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: No. 56, four people, your table is ready.

answers.nativeText: Finally, we’re up. Let’s go.
answers.help: Here you can say 终于到我们了，走吧。

hintDetail.nativeText: a modal particle which at the end of sentence and indicates a suggestion

intro.text: 如果你刚到中国，多数中国人都问你一个问题：你有微信吗？因为微信已经是中国人生活、工作中必不可少的沟通工具了。正好现在，有一位中国朋友想加你微信。
intro.nativeText: If you just arrived in China, most Chinese people will ask you the question: “Do you have WeChat?” WeChat has become an essential communication tool in all aspects of Chinese life. Now, a Chinese friend wants to add you on WeChat.

summary.nativeText: Well-done! Now you know how to add new contacts on WeChat, an incredibly popular social media app in China. Make new friends and keep in touch with them, preferably in Chinese!

learningItem.nativeText: describe the way that the verb is performed by the subject

chatTurn.question: 大卫，你用微信吗？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: David, do you use WeChat?

answers.text: 我手机上有，但是用得不多。
answers.nativeText: I have it on my cellphone, but I don’t use it much.
answers.help: Here you can say 我手机上有，但是用得不多。

chatTurn.question: 那我先加你好友吧。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Then let me add you as a friend first.

answers.nativeText: How do I do that?
answers.help: Here you can say 怎么加？

chatTurn.question: 先把二维码打开，看，在这里。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Open your QR code first. Look, here it is.

answers.nativeText: OK, it’s opened now.
answers.help: Here you can say 好的，打开了。

hintDetail.nativeText: it’s a particle after the verb to indicates the action is completed

chatTurn.question: 我来扫你。好了，收到信息了吗？
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Let me scan it. Ok have you received my message?

answers.nativeText: Yes. I just need to confirm it, right?
answers.help: Here you can say 收到了，确认就行，对吧？

chatTurn.question: 对的。好了，加上了。
chatTurn.nativeQuestion: Yeah. All right, now we are friends on WeChat.

answers.text: 我明白了，以后就微信联系吧。
answers.nativeText: I see. So now we can contact each other through WeChat.
answers.help: Here you can say 我明白了，以后就微信联系吧。
